item.title: Generations-based array
item.description: Intro I was intrigued by the sparse map/set described in Russ Cox’s article. And I’m not the only one: this exact implementation is used in Go source code more than once! The compiler uses it for many ID-like maps and sets; regexp package uses it for a queue. But there is one thing that is still bugging me: it’s hard to make it very efficient. All operations I care about are O(1), but get and set operations clearly become slower in comparison with a straightforward slice approach.
